question: Tell me about yourself/your work experience
Tell me about a time you demonstrated leadership skills
What’s a time you disagreed with a decision that was made at work?
Tell me about a time you made a mistake
Tell me about a time you failed
What’s your work style?
What’s your management style?
How do you handle stress?
What do you like to do outside of work?
What motivates you?
How do you like to be managed?
Where do you see yourself in five years?
What are your career aspirations?
How would you describe yourself?
Is there ever a good reason to lie? When?
What do you do when no one is watching, and you could get away with anything?
What’s the purpose of life, in your opinion?
What do you think is more important: happiness or meaning? Why?
Do you believe people are inherently good, evil, or shaped by experience?
What’s a flaw you’re actively working on?
How do you respond to criticism, especially if it feels unfair?
When was the last time you changed your mind about something important?
How do you handle someone you disagree with but still care about?
Would you rather be respected or liked? Why?
What role does forgiveness play in your life?
How do you make hard decisions when there's no clear right answer?
Do you believe you’re responsible for the consequences of your actions, even if your intentions were good?
Have you ever broken a rule you thought was wrong? What happened?
What do you prioritize when your values are in conflict (e.g., loyalty vs. honesty)?
What kind of people do you find it hardest to understand or get along with?
What do you think is society’s greatest blind spot?
What do you avoid doing even though it’s easy, because it goes against your principles?
How do you usually act when you're frustrated or under stress?
How do you handle boredom?
Do you prefer routine or spontaneity? Why?
What’s something small you do out of principle, even if most people wouldn’t care?
Would you steal to feed a starving loved one? Why or why not?
Is morality objective or relative? Explain your stance.
Would you follow a law you disagreed with if breaking it helped someone?
Is it ever okay to sacrifice one person for the good of many?
Do you think most people deserve second chances? What are your exceptions?
Do you believe everyone deserves kindness — even those who’ve done harm?
Are there parts of yourself you consider unchangeable? Should they be?
What’s a truth you’ve learned the hard way?
What do you do that makes you feel most like “you”?
If a lie could permanently heal someone’s trauma, would you tell it?
Would you rather be punished for something you didn’t do, or watch someone else take the blame for something you did?
Have you ever felt pleasure from someone else's downfall? What did that reveal about you?
Have you ever changed your values just to belong? Did you notice at the time?
Is suffering necessary for a meaningful life? Would you remove it if you could?
What does your tech stack look like?
Do you prefer functional or object-oriented programming?
How Would You Handle a Situation Where a Project You’re Working on Is Behind Schedule?
What aspects of your work are most lacking?
How do you approach learning a new technology or programming language?
What’s the most challenging bug you’ve ever fixed, and how did you solve it?
How do you prioritize tasks when working on multiple projects?
What’s your favorite part of the software development lifecycle, and why?
How do you handle feedback on your code during code reviews?
What strategies do you use to stay productive when working remotely?
How do you ensure your code is maintainable for future developers?
What’s a recent project you’re particularly proud of, and why?
How do you stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices?
What’s your approach to collaborating with non-technical team members?
Tell me a story about a time you wanted to do something but gave up / failed
What's your biggest regret?
What’s the most important lesson you’ve learned in your career?
What's your take on technical debt? How do you manage it?
What was the most eye-opening experience you’ve had in your career?
Brag about yourself a little.
What's your sexuality?
